reviews.review_msg: I took most of my upper division courses with Jorge and he was my favourite prof in the French department. First off, he's very intelligent, opinionated and encourages debate. People get thrown off because they might find him intimidating, but talk to him and you'll find out he's the nicest guy. He changed my perspective on life in many ways. A+

It took Jorge 2 months to mark an assignment, he makes excuses without coming up with solutions, and he doesn't respond to emails. Lectures are him talking AT you for three hours and there is little analysis of the books - you would expect more from a 4th year literature class

Didn't explain his expectations for any of the work, none of the assignments had to do with the books we read, and he was very unapproachable. It was a terrible experience and I wouldn't take a class with him again. People who hadn't had him before were totally in the dark as to what was going on and he didn't seem to care. :(

Lectures were asynchronous and maximum 40 minutes long. The grading criteria was not clear as we had weekly ateliers that were not on the syllabus. She was never at her office hours but she responds to emails and gives feedback on the final paper if you email her. Overall, she is very nice and makes the course interesting by adding in her research
